Lummis set to introduce BTC strategic reserve bill. Harris will not be at Bitcoin Nashville. BTC going to $52m by 2050: VanEck. Hashdex file for mixed BTC & ETH ETF. Coinbase to make tokenised treasuries fund. Polymarket partners with Moonpay for on-ramp. Ferrari accepts crypto in Europe. Bitfarms stopped in poison-pill strategy. Riot buys another miner for $93m.

ETH ETF volumes come out at 23% of BTC. Debate about whether strong flows will continue. SOL DEX volume continues to rise above ETH. Harris may also speak at Bitcoin Nashville. BlackRock applies for ENA cash allocation. Uber CEO wants to accept BTC.

articles.description:
Meet Mikol: the Dare dev that doused himself in isopropyl alcohol and had fireworks shot at him. He instantly went up in flames and was rushed to hospital, where it became apparent he suffered third degree burns.

In this episode, Mikol reflects on the biggest night of his life, details his injuries, and the grueling recovery process he’s still in. Despite the traumatic incident, Mikol isn’t done with the project. Instead, he’s planning to build a decentralized app where community members can take on dares in exchange for DARE tokens.
articles.title: What's the Meta? Meet the Solana Dev Who Suffered Third Degree Burns to Pump a Token

articles.description:
Are you looking for the next big opportunity in the crypto world? If so, it’s time to pay attention to Cardano (ADA) and Mpeppe (MPEPE). These two tokens are not just grabbing headlines; they are set to create substantial wealth for savvy investors in 2024. Let’s delve into why these cryptocurrencies are being hailed as the wealth makers of the coming year.
 
The Potential of Cardano (ADA) 
The excitement around Cardano (ADA) is palpable, especially with the potential introduction of an ADA-ETF. Recently, Charles Hoskinson, the founder of Cardano, hinted at the possibility of an ADA-Spot ETF. This development could revolutionize the crypto market by making Cardano (ADA) more accessible to a broader audience and promoting greater market regulation. Hoskinson’s playful hint via a GIF on soci…

articles.author: Godspower Owie
articles.description:
Following his bold statement at the Bitcoin 2024 conference in Nashville, United States Presidential candidate and crypto advocate, Robert F. Kennedy Jr. has once again demonstrated his unwavering support for Bitcoin, emphasizing its importance in promoting financial freedom and economic resilience. His continued advocacy of the digital asset is evidence of his conviction in the revolutionary potential of cryptocurrencies.
 
Bitcoin To Drive Economic Recovery In The US
 
In the race to make Bitcoin a strategic reserve asset in the US, Kennedy Jr. asserted that Bitcoin would play a crucial role in restoring the nation’s economy. The presidential candidate made the daring statement in a recent interview with Coin Stories Podcast host Natalie Brunell.
 
 
Given his strong belief that Bitcoin …
articles.title: Bitcoin Will Play A Critical Role In Restoring US Economy, Kennedy Jr Says

articles.author: Nik Hoffman
articles.description:
In a significant legislative move, Russian lawmakers have passed a bill permitting businesses to use Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies in international trade, according to a report by Retuers. This development is part of Russia's strategy to circumvent Western sanctions imposed following the invasion of Ukraine. The new law, expected to take effect in September, aims to address delays in international payments, particularly with key trading partners like China, India, and the UAE.

JUST IN: 🇷🇺 Russian law makers passes bill allowing businesses to use #Bitcoin and cryptocurrencies in international trade — Reuters pic.twitter.com/yFExWcIG9k
— Bitcoin Magazine (@BitcoinMagazine) July 30, 2024
  
  
  
Central bank Governor Elvira Nabiullina, a proponent of the law, announced that the first…
articles.title: Russia Legalizes Bitcoin And Crypto for International Trade To Bypass Sanctions

articles.author: Scott Matherson
articles.description:
Dogecoin (DOGE) proponent and Tesla CEO Elon Musk recently revealed that he isn’t exactly fond of Bitcoin and some other cryptos. His comments might come as a surprise, considering how Musk has so far been vocal and supportive about the foremost meme coin, Dogecoin. 
 
What Musk Had To Say About Bitcoin And Other Cryptos
 
Musk mentioned during an appearance at the X takeover podcast hosted by Tesla Owners Silicon Valley that he won’t be promoting crypto, and at most, it could be in a “joking way.” He further said, “If you see me pumping crypto, it’s not me,” suggesting he has no affinity or support for cryptocurrencies. However, Musk admitted that there is some “merit”  in Bitcoin and “some other cryptos.”
 
 
Meanwhile, the Tesla CEO also addressed his fondness for Dogecoin, stating that…
articles.title: Dogecoin Proponent Elon Musk Reveals Why He Doesn’t Really Like Crypto
